questions.question: In gravimetric analysis, which of the following is NOT a fundamental step?

explanations.a: Precipitation is a core step in gravimetric analysis.
explanations.b: Chromatographic separation is not part of gravimetric analysis; it's a separate technique.
explanations.c: Filtration is essential to isolate the precipitate.
explanations.d: Ignition and weighing are required to obtain accurate mass of the analyte.

questions.question: Which of the following conditions favors the formation of a pure and filterable nickel-dimethylglyoxime precipitate?

answers.a: Rapid addition of the reagent without stirring
answers.c: Slow addition of reagent with heating and stirring
answers.d: Strong acidic medium with vigorous shaking

explanations.a: Rapid addition can cause poor crystal formation and co-precipitation.
explanations.b: Acidic conditions and low temperatures hinder proper complex formation.
explanations.c: Slow addition with heating and stirring enhances purity and filterability of the precipitate.
explanations.d: Acidic media and excessive agitation can result in poor precipitate quality.
